column4: When I find all the files associated iwth one program with locate <program> how do I delete all the files?
why do you want to do this as opposed to using apt-get?
why are you downloading vim instead of using apt-get?
so why would they be untrustworthy?
because when I downloaded the file from the Ubuntu Software center it told me the file was.
and you installed it anyway?  What repository?
What repository?
apt-cache policy
I don't see why that would be untrusted.  Are you sure apt wasn't talking about something else (not the vim package)?
can you pastebin the actual message?
is this the entire output?
pastebin /etc/apt/sources.list*
and I'm fairly certain that's not the full output
they are files, open them in a text editor and pastebin the contents
and there's nothing in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/
I just checked its an empty directory
what does « sudo apt-get update » return?
it produces a bunch of links from ubuntu.com that it appears to be downloading
pastebinning is better
I don't see where you can be getting untrusted packages from.  Maybe we should just troubleshoot your vim issue?
I think that would be a good idea.
when I click on the Gvim icon in my applications area it doesnt do anything.
